title: Does an elementary teacher get paid more than a high school teacher, or vice versa? - Quora

response.answer_text: Its difficult to take a good stand in Nigeria. To answer this, the payment system will be divided into two, government and private. The government uses great level to determine the income of teachers and not whether he or she teaches in elementary or high school. Another thing is also the level of government that is responsible for the running of the concerned institution. The federal pay more than the state and local government, state government pay more than local government. The payment system in the private institutions is arbitrary and can not be said whether elementary pay more than high schools. For instance, elementary school located in maitama in abuja(federal capital territory) is more likely to pay much more than high school located in a remote area in kano state.

In the United States, unionized teachers are paid according to seniority, advanced education, and certan additional responsibilities, such as department head. I can’t address private, parochial or non-unionized schools. My hat is off to anyone who teaches at the elementary level. You are the ones who set them on the right road, get them excited about learning, and teach them, often, how to be not just students but people with regard for others. It makes no sense to me to pay any teaching level differently. We have different roles but all are equally important.

In my district, they're paid the same. All classroom teachers are paid on the same scale, so an elementary teacher and a secondary teacher with the same degree, service years, pd hours, etc., will make the same amount of money. However, on my state, elementary teachers have a lower average salary than secondary teachers do. Not sure why, elementary teachers have to work more, and have a way harder job (I teach special ed middle schoolers and I wouldn't trade them for elementary kids).

In my district, grade level and subject matter are irrelevant in regards to salary. The two key factors in determining one’s salary are experience (how long you have taught) and education (Bachelors or Masters Degree). The more you have a beach, the more money you make.

Teacher salaries are set by each individual state and school district. What determines how much one gets paid is number of years taught as well as extra duties for which each person can get compensated. It doesn’t matter whether one is elementary or high school.

For some reason that is unknown to me, Elementary Teacher’s (Primary School Teacher’s where I come from) are paid less than High School teachers. In most cases both complete a four year degree. This is the same in all countries I have ever looked at.
nope, BA tier one, MA tier 2 Phd (probably not teaching at a public school. If the teacher is bilingual or teaches a subject which is needed they get more. For example, Math and Science
